input: What does DetailedSpecification mean in the context of outdoor air specifications?
output: DetailedSpecification means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where are the Design Specification Outdoor Air and Zone Air Distribution objects referenced?
output: These objects are referenced in the Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name fields below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is in cubic meters per second. The default is 0.00944 (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated based on the number of people?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone. Occupancy schedule values are not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is one of Outdoor Air Flow per Person Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in units of m³/s-m². This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input for Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone used?
output: This input field is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the system is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the System Availability Schedule Name field blank if you want the system to be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule specify if a schedule name is specified for system availability?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0. Those times that the system is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are fan coil systems modeled in terms of fan operation?
output: Fan coil systems are modeled with continuous fan operation so this is also the supply fan operating schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the System Availability Schedule Name field is blank?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the total efficiency of the supply fan?
output: The total efficiency of the supply fan is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power. It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is impeller efficiency defined?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the total efficiency input value of the supply fan?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1. The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the pressure rise for the supply fan at full flow and standard conditions?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions. Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the supply fan motor efficiency defined?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Motor in Air Stream Fraction represent?
output: Enter the fraction of the motor heat that is added to the air stream. A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream. A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise. Must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified in the schedule name to ensure the system is available for the entire year?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What value should the schedule have when the system is not available?
output: Those times that the system is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How are fan coil systems modeled in terms of fan operation?
output: Fan coil systems are modeled with continuous fan operation so this is also the supply fan operating schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the supply fan operating schedule field is left blank?
output: If this field is blank the schedule has values of 1 for all time periods.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the total efficiency of the supply fan?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan. This value is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power. It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is impeller efficiency defined?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the formula for the power delivered to the fluid?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the supply fan total efficiency input value?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1. The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What conditions are considered standard for the supply fan delta pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the supply fan motor efficiency calculated?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed. Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 0 mean for the supply fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 0 means that the motor is completely outside the air stream.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of 1 mean for the supply fan motor in air stream fraction?
output: A value of 1 means that all of the motor heat will go into the air stream and act to cause a temperature rise.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the three cooling coil types available?
output: There are three coil types available: ChilledWater ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel and HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What object does the ChilledWater coil type use?
output: ChilledWater uses the Coil:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the preferred coil model for most applications?
output: The preferred coil model for most applications is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What object does the ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel coil type use?
output: ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater coil type?
output: HeatExchangerAssistedChilledWater uses CoilSystem:Cooling:Water:HeatExchangerAssisted with Coil:Cooling:Water for enhanced dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil type?
output: The default is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the cooling coil availability schedule name is set to blank?
output: If set to blank it allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the cooling coil availability schedule name most often used?
output: It is most often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the cooling coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the cooling coil design setpoint?
output: This is the design supply air temperature in C used to size the cooling supply air flow and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the cooling coil design setpoint used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil design setpoint temperature?
output: The default is 14°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the two types of heating coils available?
output: There are two types available HotWater and Electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating coil type?
output: The default is HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the heating coil availability schedule name is set to blank?

output: ChilledWater uses the Coil:Cooling:Water object with the DetailedAnalysis option and is the preferred coil model for most applications.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Which cooling coil type is available for special applications?
output: ChilledWaterDetailedFlatModel uses the Coil:Cooling:Water:DetailedGeometry object and is available for special applications.

output: It uses CoilSystem:Cooling:Water:HeatExchangerAssisted with Coil:Cooling:Water for enhanced dehumidification.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default cooling coil type?
output: The default is ChilledWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Cooling Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the cooling coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if a schedule name is specified for the cooling coil?
output: It defines when the coil is available most often used when cooling is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate for the cooling coil?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the cooling coil can be on during a given time period.

input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the cooling coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the cooling coil cannot be used during that time period.

input: What is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint used for?
output: It is the design supply air temperature in C used to size the cooling supply air flow and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Cooling Coil Design Setpoint field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

output: The default is 14°C.

input: What are the available heating coil types?
output: There are two types available HotWater and Electric.

input: What is the default setting for the Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the heating coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: It is the design supply air temperature in C used to size the heating supply air flow and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Heating Coil Design Setpoint field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default heating coil design setpoint?
output: The default is 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field?
output: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object if this zone is served by a dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the outdoor air flow rate if a Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name is entered?
output: The outdoor air flow rate for this zone equipment object will be set to zero and the DOAS will provide the ventilation air to the zone based on the outdoor air specifications in this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the fancoil Capacity Control Method set to if a DOAS system is specified?
output: The Capacity Control Method will be set to CyclingFan if a DOAS system is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field is blank?
output: The zone served by this fancoil system will not be served by a DOAS and the fancoil Capacity Control Method will be ConstantFanVariableFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does SupplyAirTemperature mean in the context of the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Cooling Coil Design Setpoint will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does TemperatureDifference mean in the context of the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the heating coil most often used?
output: The heating coil is most often used when heating is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do the schedule values denote?
output: The schedule values denote whether the heating coil can run during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of one indicate?
output: A schedule value of one indicates that the heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote?
output: A value of zero denotes that the heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

input: What is the Field: Heating Coil Design Setpoint?
output: This is the design supply air temperature in C used to size the heating supply air flow and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Heating Coil Design Setpoint field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Heating Coil Design Setpoint?
output: The default is 50°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Field: Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name?
output: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object if this zone is served by a dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when a Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name is entered?
output: The outdoor air flow rate for this zone equipment object will be set to zero and the DOAS will provide the ventilation air to the zone based on the outdoor air specifications in this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Capacity Control Method for a fancoil system if a DOAS system is specified?
output: The Capacity Control Method will be set to CyclingFan if a DOAS system is specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field is blank?
output: If this field is blank then the zone served by this fancoil system will not be served by a DOAS and the fancoil Capacity Control Method will be ConstantFanVariableFlow.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does SupplyAirTemperature mean for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Cooling Coil Design Setpoint will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does TemperatureDifference mean for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: The default is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Field: Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: The temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is TemperatureDifference.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: The default is 11.11 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does SupplyAirTemperature mean for the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Heating Coil Design Setpoint will be used for sizing the zone heating design air flow rate and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does TemperatureDifference mean for the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: The default is SupplyAirTemperature.
