instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Flow/Area option mean in the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: It means the program will use the input from the field Outdoor Air Flow per Zone Floor Area to calculate a zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Sum option mean in the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: It means that the flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Maximum option mean in the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: It means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default setting for the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: The default is Flow/Person.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the DetailedSpecification option mean in the Outdoor Air Method field?
output: It means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where are the objects referenced in the DetailedSpecification option?
output: These objects are referenced in the Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name fields below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for this zone is in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default design outdoor air flow rate per person?
output: The default is 0.00944 cubic meters per second (20 cfm per person).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the outdoor air flow rate calculated for a zone?
output: An outdoor air flow rate is calculated based on the total number of people for all People statements assigned to the zone.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Are occupancy schedule values applied when calculating the outdoor air flow rate?
output: No occupancy schedule values are not applied.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Person input used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is one of Outdoor Air Flow per Person Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is in units of m^3/s-m^2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the flow rate obtained using the Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area input?
output: This input is multiplied by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Outdoor Air Flow Rate per Zone Floor Area input used?
output: This input is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Area Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What method is used to calculate the zone design outdoor air flow rate?
output: The flows calculated from the fields Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be added to obtain the zone design outdoor air flow rate when using the 'Sum' method.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the 'Maximum' method mean for calculating the zone design outdoor air flow rate?
output: The 'Maximum' method means that the maximum flow derived from Outdoor Air Flow per Person Outdoor Air Flow per Area and Outdoor Air Flow per Zone will be used for the zone design outdoor air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for calculating the zone design outdoor air flow rate?
output: The default method is 'Flow/Person'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DetailedSpecification' mean in the context of outdoor air specifications?
output: 'DetailedSpecification' means that the outdoor air specifications will be taken from a DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir or DesignSpecification:OutdoorAir:SpaceList object and optional DesignSpecification:ZoneAirDistribution object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Where are the outdoor air specification objects referenced?
output: These objects are referenced in the Design Specification Outdoor Air Object Name and Design Specification Zone Air Distribution Object Name fields below.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate per person for a zone is 0.00944 cubic meters per second (20 cfm per person) by default.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per person used?
output: This input is used if the 'Outdoor Air Method' is one of 'Outdoor Air Flow per Person' 'Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area calculated?
output: The design outdoor air volumetric flow rate per square meter of floor area is calculated by multiplying the input by the zone area to obtain a flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per zone floor area used?
output: This input is used if the 'Outdoor Air Method' is 'Flow/Area' 'Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for a zone?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for a zone is specified in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the outdoor air flow rate per zone used?
output: This input field is used if the 'Outdoor Air Method' is 'Flow/Zone' 'Sum' or 'Maximum'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the system is to be available for the entire year?
output: Leave the field blank if you want the system to be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule indicate when the system is available?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the fan operating mode schedule indicates continuous fan operation?
output: The fan will operate whenever this schedule is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What occurs if the fan operating schedule indicates cycling fan operation?
output: The fan will only cycle on as needed to meet a load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 0 denote for the supply air fan operating mode?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote that the supply air fan and the heating or cooling coil cycle on and off together to meet the heating or cooling load (a.k.a. AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the supply fan operating mode schedule field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank a schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the supply fan placement type?
output: The alpha field has two choices 'DrawThrough' or 'BlowThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'DrawThrough' model in the context of supply fan placement?
output: 'DrawThrough' models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does 'BlowThrough' model in the context of supply fan placement?
output: 'BlowThrough' models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply fan placement type?
output: The default is 'DrawThrough'.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the design outdoor air flow rate for this zone measured in?
output: The design outdoor air flow rate for this zone is measured in cubic meters per second.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the input field for the design outdoor air flow rate used?
output: This input field is used if Outdoor Air Method is Flow/Zone Sum or Maximum.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should you do if you want the system to be available for the entire year for heating or cooling?
output: Leave the System Availability Schedule Name field blank if you want the system to be available for the entire year to perform heating or cooling if called for by the thermostat.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule name indicate when the system is available?
output: If a schedule name is specified those times that the system is available should be specified as 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the schedule indicate when the system is not available?
output: Those times that the system is not available should have a zero value in the schedule specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the fan operating mode schedule indicates continuous fan operation?
output: The fan will operate whenever this schedule is 1.0.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the fan operating schedule indicates cycling fan operation?
output: The fan will only cycle on as needed to meet a load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name field specify?
output: This field specifies the name of the supply air fan operating mode schedule.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How may the supply air fan operating mode vary during the simulation?
output: The supply air fan operating mode may vary during the simulation based on time-of-day or with a change of season.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values of 0 denote for the supply air fan?
output: Schedule values of 0 denote that the supply air fan and the heating or cooling coil cycle on and off together to meet the heating or cooling load (a.k.a. AUTO fan).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What do schedule values other than 0 denote for the supply air fan?
output: Schedule values other than 0 denote that the supply fan runs continuously while the heating or cooling coil cycles to meet the load.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Supply Fan Operating Mode Schedule Name field is left blank?
output: If this field is left blank a schedule of always zero (cycling fan) will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Supply Fan Placement field?
output: This alpha field has two choices DrawThrough or BlowThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does DrawThrough model in terms of supply fan placement?
output: DrawThrough models a system where the supply air fan is after the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does BlowThrough model in terms of supply fan placement?
output: BlowThrough models a system where the supply air fan is before the cooling and heating coils.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply fan placement?
output: The default is DrawThrough.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Total Efficiency field represent?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan. This value is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the supply fan calculated?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the motor efficiency?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the impeller efficiency?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the Supply Fan Total Efficiency input value?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supply Fan Total Efficiency?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Delta Pressure field specify?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the standard conditions for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supply Fan Delta Pressure?
output: The default is 75.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Supply Fan Motor Efficiency field represent?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the range for the Supply Fan Motor Efficiency?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supply Fan Motor Efficiency?
output: The default is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Type field specify?
output: Enter the type of cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the current choice for the Cooling Coil Type field?
output: At the present time there is currently only one choice for this field: Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity field specify?
output: Enter autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil gross rated total capacity based on the maximum cooling loads during the cooling design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value entered in the Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity field represent?
output: If a value is entered it represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity?
output: Rated conditions are 26.7°C (80°F) entering air dry-bulb temperature 19.4°C (67°F) entering air wet-bulb temperature and 29.4°C (85°F) entering water temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the total efficiency of the supply fan?
output: Enter the total efficiency of the supply fan. This value is the overall efficiency of the fan i.e. the ratio of the power delivered to the fluid to the electrical input power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the total efficiency of the supply fan calculated?
output: It is the product of the motor efficiency and the impeller efficiency.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is motor efficiency defined?
output: The motor efficiency is the power delivered to the shaft divided by the electrical power input to the motor.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is impeller efficiency defined?
output: The impeller efficiency is power delivered to the fluid (air) divided by the shaft power.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the power delivered to the fluid calculated?
output: The power delivered to the fluid is the mass flow rate of the air multiplied by the pressure rise divided by the air density.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the total efficiency input value?
output: This input value must be between 0 and 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the total efficiency of the supply fan?
output: The default is 0.7.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Supply Fan Delta Pressure specify?
output: Enter the pressure rise in Pa at full flow and standard conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are considered standard conditions for the supply fan delta pressure?
output: Standard conditions are considered 20°C at sea level 101325 Pa.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default pressure rise for the supply fan?
output: The default is 75.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Supply Fan Motor Efficiency specify?
output: Enter the shaft power of the supply fan divided by the electrical power consumed.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the valid range for the supply fan motor efficiency?
output: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the supply fan motor efficiency?
output: The default is 0.9.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Cooling Coil Type specify?
output: Enter the type of cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the current choice for the cooling coil type?
output: At the present time there is currently only one choice for this field: Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Total Capacity specify?
output: Enter autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the cooling coil gross rated total capacity based on the maximum cooling loads during the cooling design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity represent?
output: If a value is entered it represents the full load gross total cooling capacity including both sensible and latent capacity in watts of the DX coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the rated conditions for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: Rated conditions are 26.7°C (80°F) entering air dry-bulb temperature 19.4°C (67°F) entering air wet-bulb temperature and 29.4°C (85°F) entering water temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How should the capacity be considered for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: Capacity should be 'gross' i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is recommended if a value is specified for the cooling coil gross rated total capacity?
output: If a value is specified for this field it is recommended that the Cooling Coil Rated Sensible Heat Ratio also be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio specify?
output: Enter Autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the sensible heat ratio based on the rated capacity and air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered if not using autosize for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: Otherwise enter the value of the ratio of the gross sensible capacity divided by gross total cooling capacity of the DX cooling coil at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be considered when defining the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR)?
output: Both the sensible and total cooling capacities used to define the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio (SHR) should be 'gross' i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be done if the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity is autosized?
output: If the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity is autosized this field should also be autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity has a specified value?
output: If the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity has a specified value then this field should also have a specified value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Why should the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio have a specified value if the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity has one?
output: This is because the Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit object has fields for Rated Total Cooling Capacity and Rated Sensible Cooling Capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the cooling coil gross rated sensible heat ratio is autosized?
output: If this field is autosized a specified value for Cooling Coil Rated Capacity will not be used when the coil object sensible capacity is autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Field: Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP specify?
output: Enter the coefficient of performance defined as the gross cooling coil capacity in watts divided by electrical power input in watts of the DX cooling coil unit at rated conditions.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default unit for supply air fan heat?
output: The units are in W. The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be specified if a value for supply air fan heat is given?
output: It is recommended that the Cooling Coil Rated Sensible Heat Ratio also be specified.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Cooling Coil Gross Rated Sensible Heat Ratio field determine?
output: It determines the sensible heat ratio based on the rated capacity and air flow rate.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What temperature conditions are used for defining the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio?
output: 26.7C (80F) entering air dry-bulb temperature 19.4C (67F) entering air wet-bulb temperature and 29.4C (85F) entering water temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should both the sensible and total cooling capacities used to define the Rated Sensible Heat Ratio be?
output: They should be 'gross' i.e. the effect of supply air fan heat is not accounted for.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity is autosized?
output: This field should also be autosized.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Cooling Coil Rated Capacity has a specified value?
output: Then this field should also have a specified value.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Coil:Cooling:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit object have fields for?
output: It has fields for Rated Total Cooling Capacity and Rated Sensible Cooling Capacity.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Cooling Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: The default is 3.5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should the gross COP not account for?
output: The gross COP should not account for the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the current choice for the Heat Pump Heating Coil Type field?
output: Coil:Heating:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default for the Heat Pump Heating Coil Gross Rated Capacity?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default Heat Pump Heating Coil Gross Rated COP?
output: The default is 4.2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the usual setting for the Supplemental Heating Coil Availability Schedule Name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the heating coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the power include for the compressor and condenser fan?
output: The power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Should the gross COP account for the supply air fan?
output: The gross COP should not account for the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the gross COP?
output: The default is 3.5.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the heat pump heating coil type?
output: Enter the type of heat pump heating coil. There is currently only one choice for this field: Coil:Heating:WaterToAirHeatPump:EquationFit.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the heat pump heating coil gross rated capacity determined?
output: Enter autosize to let the automatic sizing algorithm determine the heat pump heating coil gross capacity based on the maximum heating loads during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value for the heat pump heating coil gross rated capacity represent?
output: If a value is entered it represents the full load heating capacity in watts of the DX heat pump unit at rated conditions (21.11C (70F) entering air dry-bulb temperature and 21.11C (70F) entering water temperature).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the unit for the heat pump heating coil gross rated capacity?
output: The units are in W.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heat pump heating coil gross rated capacity?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the coefficient of performance for the heat pump heating coil defined?
output: Enter the coefficient of performance defined as the gross heating coil capacity in watts divided by electrical power input in watts of the DX heating coil unit at rated conditions (21.11C (70F) entering air dry-bulb temperature and 21.11C (70F) entering water temperature).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the input power for the heat pump heating coil include?
output: The input power includes electric power for the compressor and condenser fan but does not include the power consumption of the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: Should the gross COP for the heat pump heating coil account for the supply air fan?
output: The gross COP should not account for the supply air fan.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the heat pump heating coil gross rated COP?
output: The default is 4.2.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the usual setting for the supplemental heating coil availability schedule name?
output: Usually set to blank which allows the heating coil to be available anytime the system is operating.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified schedule name for the supplemental heating coil availability define?
output: If a schedule name is specified it defines when the coil is available. This is most often used when supplemental heating is only available seasonally.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the supplemental heating coil?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the supplemental heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a value of zero denote in the schedule for the supplemental heating coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the supplemental heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How is the supplemental heating coil capacity determined?
output: Enter autosize to allow the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a specified value for the supplemental heating coil capacity represent?
output: If a value is specified it is the maximum amount of heat that the supplemental heating coil can deliver in Watts.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the supplemental heating coil capacity?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the maximum cycling rate field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor which occurs at 50% run time fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is the suggested value source for the maximum cycling rate?
output: Suggested values are shown below (Henderson et al. 1999):

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the latent capacity time constant field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the time constant for the cooling coil's capacity to reach steady state after startup.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What is the suggested value source for the latent capacity time constant?
output: Suggested values are shown below (Henderson et al. 1999):

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the heat pump fan delay time field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the time delay in seconds for the heat pump supply air fan to shut off after compressor cycle off.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: How can the heat pump fan delay time value be obtained?
output: This value can be obtained from the manufacturer or the heat pump catalog.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the suggested value for the heat pump fan delay time?
output: Suggested value is 60 seconds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the heat pump fan delay time value disregarded?
output: This value is disregarded at times when the WaterToAirHeatPump's fan operating mode schedule value is greater than 0 (i.e. continuous fan mode).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the schedule value of 1.0 indicate for the supplemental heating coil?
output: A schedule value of 1.0 indicates that the supplemental heating coil can be on during a given time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does a schedule value of zero denote for the supplemental heating coil?
output: A value of zero denotes that the supplemental heating coil cannot be used during that time period.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when 'autosize' is entered for the Supplemental Heating Coil Capacity?
output: Entering 'autosize' allows the sizing algorithm to determine the proper capacity required based on the loads experienced during the heating design day.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Supplemental Heating Coil Capacity?
output: The default is autosize.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Maximum Cycling Rate field contain?
output: This numeric field contains the maximum on-off cycling rate for the compressor which occurs at 50% run time fraction.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/

output: This numeric field contains the time constant for the cooling coil's capacity to reach steady state after startup.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> figure in /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/
input: What figure is associated with the Latent Capacity Time Constant?
output: The figure is located at /UAStudy/EnergyPlus/doc/input-output-reference/media/image606.png.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The suggested value is 60 seconds.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens when the WaterToAirHeatPump's fan operating mode schedule value is greater than 0?
output: The Heat Pump Fan Delay Time value is disregarded.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered for the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field?
output: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object if this zone is served by a dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens if the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field is left blank?
output: The zone served by this water-to-air heat pump system will not be served by a DOAS.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the choices for the Supplemental Heating Coil Type field?
output: The choices are Electric and HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default type for the Supplemental Heating Coil?
output: The default is Electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the SupplyAirTemperature method mean?
output: It means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: The default is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the supply air temperature used for in the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature field?
output: The supply air temperature is used for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default supply air temperature for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature field?
output: The default is 14°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What should be entered in the Name field for a zone served by a dedicated outdoor air system?
output: Enter the name of an HVACTemplate:System:DedicatedOutdoorAir object if this zone is served by a dedicated outdoor air system (DOAS).

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What happens to the outdoor air flow rate for a zone equipment object when a Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name is entered?
output: The outdoor air flow rate for this zone equipment object will be set to zero and the DOAS will provide the ventilation air to the zone based on the outdoor air specifications in this object.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default behavior if the Dedicated Outdoor Air System Name field is blank?
output: If this field is blank then the zone served by this water-to-air heat pump system will not be served by a DOAS.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What are the options for the Supplemental Heating Coil Type field?
output: The choices for this field are Electric and HotWater.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default type for the Supplemental Heating Coil?
output: The default is Electric.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the cooling design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the SupplyAirTemperature option mean in the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature will be used for sizing the zone cooling design air flow rate and the cooling coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the TemperatureDifference option mean in the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field?
output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default method for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method?
output: The default is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature field?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: When is the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature field used?
output: This field is used only when Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature?
output: The default is 14°C.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference used for?
output: The temperature difference between the cooling design supply air temperature and the zone air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone cooling design air flow rate calculation and cooling coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the default value for the Zone Cooling Design Supply Air Temperature Difference?
output: The default is 11.11 deltaC.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field select?
output: This field selects the method for specifying the heating design supply air temperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What does the SupplyAirTemperature option mean in the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method field?
output: SupplyAirTemperature means that the field Heating Coil Design Setpoint will be used for sizing the zone heating design air flow rate and the heating coil.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: TemperatureDifference means that the field Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Difference will be used.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: The default is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
input: What is the purpose of the Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature field?
output: The supply air temperature in degrees Celsius for the zone heating design air flow rate calculation and heating coil sizing.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

output: This field is used only when Zone Heating Design Supply Air Temperature Input Method is SupplyAirTemperature.

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text

instruction: Imagine you are a helpful assistant and building energy expert for the energyPlus Engineering Reference -> Chapter: HVAC Template Objects -> Section: Group -- HVAC Templates -> text
